stimulusHtml: Which of the following is true of the sphere when it reaches the bottom of the ramp?

features.html: A sphere is held at rest at the top of a ramp, as shown. The sphere is released and rolls without slipping down the ramp. The gravitational potential energy of the sphere-Earth system is zero at the bottom of the ramp.

choicesHtml: The sphere’s rotational kinetic energy equals the initial potential energy of the sphere-Earth system.
The sphere’s translational kinetic energy equals the initial potential energy of the sphere-Earth system.
The sphere’s translational kinetic energy and rotational kinetic energy are equal.
The sum of the sphere’s translational kinetic energy and rotational kinetic energy equals the initial potential energy of the sphere-Earth system.
